meanings.sent1: She will prenotify the guests about the party.
meanings.sent2: He always prenotifies his colleagues before making any changes.
meanings.sent3: The cat prenotified the birds before pouncing on them.
meanings.sent4: The sun prenotifies the coming of a new day with its first light.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock prenotified the start of the school day with its loud ring.

meanings.definition: The act of giving advance notice.
meanings.sent1: Her prenotifying of the meeting saved us from missing it.
meanings.sent2: The prenotifying of the storm allowed people to prepare.
meanings.sent3: The prenotifying of the surprise party almost ruined the surprise.
meanings.sent4: The prenotifying of the train's arrival was heard throughout the station.
meanings.sent5: The prenotifying of the deadline helped everyone plan their work accordingly.
